title: Policeman, two people caught with 108kg 'ice'
text:
Policeman, two people caught with 108kg 'ice' 22 Feb 2017 at 10:58 127 viewed 0 comments WRITER: ONLINE REPORTERS - + Narcotics Suppression Bureau police have arrested a junior traffic police officer and two other persons and seized from them 108 kilogrammes of "ice" or crystal methamphetamine, police said. 
Acting on a tipoff at about 9pm on Tuesday, NSB police arrested Pol Lance Corporal Pitsanupong Ngamthura, an officer of Traffic Police Sub-division 6, after he showed up with a black suitcase on floor 5B of a parking building of Lumpiniville condominium in Soi Sukhumvit 77 in Suan Luang district. 
The NSB police allegedly found in the suitcase 28kg of ice. 
Pol L/Cpl Pitsanupong reportedly confessed to taking the drugs from the Thian Thale area in Thon Buri. He claimed he would hand over the drugs to clients at the parking building of the condominium. 
In a subsequent search of Pol L/Cpl Pitsanupong's room No 615/76 in that condominium, the police allegedly found two 9mm pistols with some ammunition. 
Information from him led the NSB police to seize another 80kg of ice from the Thian Thale area, but nobody was arrested. 
Shortly afterwards, two more suspects were arrested at Don Mueang airport. Pol L/Cpl Pitsanupong allegedly said on being arrested that the drugs he was delivering to clients belonged to them. 
The two, who had not been identified, were taken to the NSB headquarters for questioning. RECOMMENDED STORIES
